question: Select an aspect of measurement
details: Is there a better phrasing for the question?

question: The amplitude is measured from
details: Please specify details of how the waveforms were constructed in the further clarification text. The details should be sufficient to allow replication. For discussion: any way to help with reporting complex steps such as measurement from waveforms that are transformed by source localization?
choices: 1. single waves (one condition) | 2. difference waves | 3. waves obtained using transformation of raw data (e.g. sPCA, source localization) | 4. other

question: What was the procedure used for amplitude measurement in the selected time window?
details: Select procedure which was used for amplitude measurement in this time window.  If area measure is selected, please specify how this measure was calculated (e.g. rectified, signed, integral) in the Further clarification section.  If factor scores were used, please specify the details.  If other is selected, please specify further details in the Further Clarification section
choices: 1. amplitude mean | 2. amplitude peak | 3. factor scores based on factor analysis | 4. window area measure (specify e.g. rectified, signed, integral) | 5. each time point separately | 6.multiple measurement types | 7.other

question: If area measure is selected, please specify how this measure was calculated
If factor scores were used, please specify the details.
If other is selected, please specify further details
Approach to amplitude measurement window selection
details: A priori: the window is selected in advance Data-driven: the measurement window is selected based on data obtained in the current study. In a data driven approach, either a wider window or the entire epoch are analyzed or examined to determine which will be the final measurement window.  [if 1 was selected, jump to 6.3.3.1; if 2 was selected, jumpe to6.3.3.2] If 3 or 4 was selected, specify in "further clarification" filed.
choices: 1. a priori | 2. data-driven | 3. no window selection (e.g. point-by-point analysis such as mass univariate analysis) | 4. other
item_pref_label: Approach to amplitude measurement window selection

question: If the amplitude measurement window is selected in advance (a priori), select the procedure which was used for amplitude measurement in this time window.
choices: 1. As described in previous literature | 2. arbitrary windows across epoch with/without overlap (time windows decided in advance) | 3. other

question: If previous literature was selected, please provide references.
If 2 or 3 were selected, please provide futher details needed for replication.
If the amplitude measurement window is selected using data driven methods, select the procedure which was used for amplitude measurement in this time window.
choices: 1. visual inspection | 2. consecutive significant tests to determine the start and the end of a window that will be analysed  | 3. window around a peak | 4. windows accross epoch with/without overlap (time windows decided after seeing the waveforms, specify details) | 5. other

question: Broader time window used for locating the measurement window: START [ms]
details: For data-driven approaches only: Please provide here the start of the broader window which was examined to determine the measurement window.  If the entire epoch was analyzed, enter “0”.

question: Broader time window used for locating the measurement window.where we looked for amplitude: END [ms]
details: For data-driven approaches only: Please provide here the start of the broader window which was examined to determine the analysis window.  If the entire epoch was analyzed, enter the epoch end.

question: Please provide here the start of the window which was used to measure amplitude. Measurement window: START [ms]

question: Describe the latency type.
Onset latency measure
choices: 1. midpoint - peak | 2. midpoint - local peak | 4. midpoint - 50% area | 5. midpoint - other

question: Peak latency measure
details: Select procedure which was used for latency measurement in this time window and describe all details neccessary for replicating this procedure in Further clarification.
choices: 1. onset - extrapolation based on slope | 2. onset - difference larger than chance | 3. onset - N consecutive significant comparisons | 4. onset - fractational area (e.g. 30% area) | 5. onset - fractational peak (e.g. 50% peak) | 6. onset - other

question: Latency measured from
details: Please specify details of how the waveforms were constructed in the further clarification text. The details should be sufficient to allow replication.  For discussion: any way to help with reporting complex steps such as measurement from waveforms that are transformed by source localization?
choices: 1. single waves (one condition) | 2. difference waves | 3. waves obtained using transformation of raw data (e.g. sPCA, source localization) | 4. other

question: Approach to selection of the window within which latency was located (multi choice)
details: A priori: the window is selected in advance Data-driven: the measurement window is selected based on data obtained in the current study. In a data driven approach, either a wider window or the entire epoch are analyzed or examined to determine which will be the final analysis window.  Entire epoch: latency is identified based on the entire epoch instead of a narrower window (e.g. peak of the entire waveform, mass univariate approch on the entire epoch etc.). Please specify details in the Further clarification column [if 1 was selected, jump to 6.4.2.1; if 2 was selected, jumpe to 6.4.2.2] If 3 or 4 was selected, specify in "further clarification" filed.
choices: 1.A priori | 2.Data-driven | 3.latency identified based on the entire epoch | 4. other

details: Select procedure which was used for latency measurement in this time window.  Please provide references if 1 was selected and rationale if 2 was selected   Skip 6.4.2-6.4.4. and jump to 6.4.5.
